Career Pathway

Logistics & Transport

Yorkshire&apos;s strategic location makes it a hub for logistics and transport, connecting businesses across the UK and beyond.

2,800+
Businesses
65,000+
Employee jobs
£29,000
Average earnings
Career Journey

Career progression in logistics & transport

Entry level

View roles
Warehouse OperativeDelivery DriverTransport Clerk

Intermediate

View roles
Team LeaderFleet CoordinatorTransport Planner

Advanced level

View roles
Logistics ManagerSupply Chain ManagerOperations Director
Required Skills

Top skills requested by employers

Skills for logistics & transport jobs can be split between 'general' skills and 'specialist' skills. General or transferable skills are more focused on the sector.

General skills

Organisation
Time management
Communication
Problem solving
Customer service

Specialist skills

Route planning
Inventory management
Supply chain operations
Transport regulations
Fleet management
Find training opportunities
Sustainable Careers

Green Logistics

The logistics sector is transforming to reduce environmental impact through sustainable practices:

Sustainable Transport ManagerElectric Fleet CoordinatorGreen Supply Chain Specialist
